intro: Crambe hispanica, commonly known as Spanish crambe, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the Brassicaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes cultivated for its edible seeds.
